message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and there is an increased risk of elevated blood pressure in children with ADHD. Serotonin syndrome is a rare side effect of certain medications, increased BMI may be a result of decreased physical activity, and decreased perspiration is not a known risk factor for ADHD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), which is associated with an increased risk of elevated blood pressure. Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening side effect of certain medications. Increased BMI may be a long-term consequence of untreated ADHD, but it is not an immediate risk.
